PMR590.name: Special Problems
PMR590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PMR590.description: Each student works under faculty direction on an experimental, theoretical or applied problem in physical medicine and rehabilitation.

PMR601.name: Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Clerkship
PMR601.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PMR601.description: Physical medicine and rehabilitation inpatient and ambulatory setting clinical experience, didactic sessions, case documentation and presentation, hospital rounds. Strong emphasis on evaluation of neuromusculoskeletal disorders and treatment of function deficits.
PMR601.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.
